user_review: I love this place! Solid, delicious, hearty food with some great cocktails, nice servers and a fun ambiance. We don't live especially close to it, but we will go out of our way to come here.I love the prime rib/prime rib sandwich. Flavorful, salty, fatty meat that's good on a plate with veggies or with melted cheese on a sandwich. Can't go wrong really. My husband (who is half British and lived in England for a bit) loves the Ploughman's, which comes with so many different little bites of meat, cheese, pickled items and crusty bread.  It's pretty hearty despite being on the "peckish" side of the menu. The chicken tikka masala is also well done if you feel like something else. They have an interesting cocktail menu and changing specials made by great bartenders. Looking forward to being able to come back here for some hearty winter fare when they can open again!

We went there with all our friends from the "gang" and the bar staff gave us five rounds of shots for free ! But it was Crown royal so Courteney barfed . We also ordered the calamari rings and they tasted just like at the M&M restaurant in Kanata! Good thing the beers were 14$ each because Meghyyyn would have drunk 12 . Also the guy with the spider tattoo on his ear has bad breath.

A second try at this place, not for breakfast, just for drinks after dinner across the street, and it was a much better experience. We sat at the bar, my best friend and I, and made fast friends with a couple of men next to us. The bartender was so much fun, regularly jumping in on whatever we were all talking about and making us laugh. The drinks flowed nicely all evening. We had intended to go to another bar that evening, and didn't. We basically closed this one instead. Another experience was for dinner, and the evening food choices are much better than their breakfast!

Coming home from Tremblant, my friends and I wanted to stop by Montreal and eat somewhere so my boyfriend told us about this place and I thought it was promising. There is only Street parking so be prepared to look for a place to park since it's a busy area. When we got inside my boyfriend had made reservations so we were seated quickly. The menu had various options so my friends and I ordered two fish and chips (one with poutine, and one without), Samoa's, chicken tikki masala, steak frites (medium), and Mac and cheese. I also ordered a cocktail which had gin and cucumbers. Very refreshing! So this is where everything went downhill: So my friends steak frites came out and it LOOKED really good... Brussel sprouts and fries with steak. A promising presentation but when my friend cut into his steak it was well done. Looked dry and so he was a little disappointed. We told our waiter that the steak was dry so we ordered a different dish (another chicken tikki masaala), and when my friends fish and chips with poutine came out there was no poutine either. Disappointing. Again. So we had told the chef that we ordered poutine. He said it wasn't in the ticket and took the plate. Came back and said again it wasn't on the ticket and to discuss with the waitress. IMO, I felt like that was a waste of time taking his dish to the back and then not adding the poutine. Luckily, our waitress KNEW she had put the poutine in our ticket so he ended up getting the poutine. The Mac and cheese was my absolute favorite!!! I haven't had Mac and cheese in so long but it was super cheesy, not dry and a great portion to share with a group of four. Their chicken tikki masala was not my favorite. Had a weird taste to it but I enjoyed the fish and chips! Came with mashed peas, tartar sauce, lemon and vinegar.My boyfriend asked for a refill on coffee but the waiter had given him cold coffee when he wanted hot. My boyfriend mentioned it to him, but the waiter just simply said "it's good right? It's French"! Ummm okay lol..... everyone got a refill on their water but when I asked the waiter simply walked away. I thought that was funny to me.Overall the experience here was.... less than satisfactory... I wouldn't come back here simply because the service was just  not that good. Don't get me wrong our waitress was  nice but the service is not worth experiencing again.

Great food, friendly service, and a cute terrace. This place is great! Ordered the mac and cheese and London tea party to share with a friend and it was perfect. I thought the food was so comforting and just plain delicious.I got a lemonade cocktail and that was the only thing I wouldn't get again, and that's only because I'm not a big fan of cocktails to begin with. I'd absolutely come back.

This is a very nice 3-level establishment.  We arrived for a football match, and it was quite busy.  Having waited patiently to be seated, the manager made sure that we got a table in time for kickoff.  Our server was excellent, and took care of a great number of customers in a timely manner.  Beers and food were all good -- I recommend the Scotch Egg if you're not hungry enough for a full meal.  A very well-managed place!

This pub never disappoints. I've been here multiple times on different days and even when I think there's no space, they somehow manage to seat us. We were a little sad to not get a table and to be seated at the bar instead. However, the joke was on us as it was definitely more private and as it tends to get loud as the night goes on, we were still able to hear each other and not have to hell across the table.Their menu has many of their specialty cocktails but ask for any other and they'll happy to make it for you, a big 5 star to the staff. The place is always clean and has a cozy pub feel without the overwhelming smell of beer.

One of favorite spot for brunch! It embraces decent price, delicious food and enjoyable environment, the three key factors for me. You must try the salmon Benedict! I have tried in so many places. It is still top 1 from my within

What a fantastic pub! Stopped here on St. Andrew's Day for some scotch eggs and we were not disappointed. The interior was warm, inviting and lively. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We didn't have just one waiter. The entire staff works as a team. Any of them walking by your table will offer to get you a drink, take your order, clear your plates or bring you a dessert menu. No one said, "let me get "your" server". It was in every sense of the word a team effort. I wish more restaurants would run this way. It was an amazing experience. The food itself was delicious. We had the scotch egg which had a little spicy kick to it and just made it so much tastier. The poutine with beef was quickly devoured by my husband who "doesn't like poutine" (uh huh) and the mac and cheese was just perfect. Would definitely recommend and will be coming back for sure.

It was not our first time to this pub and I would make it my regular place to go if I didn't live across town. But last night was a special time for me. It was my birthday, so my girlfriend and I selected this place for a nice pub supper as they know how to do things right. We both selected the Sheppard's pie with lamb. WOW! It was excellent. The portion was just right and the wine was exquisite. The service was above par and very attentive. If you are looking for a pub that offer good beer selection, good food and good music, the Burgundy Lion is the place

I've been to this pub only a handful of times. I went last about a month ago to watch a Premier League soccer game (this pub is great for watching the premier league) and had a blast. The pub itself is pretty nice but the crowd it attracts makes it even better, the atmosphere was just right and if you're into whisky, if I remember correctly, they have the biggest collection in all of Quebec. I personally had a beer, my other friends had the full English breakfast, and they were saying that it was so great, actually one of them is from the UK herself, I know I'll be ordering one the next time I go to watch a soccer game.

This place has been around for a long time and a great spot to grab drinks any evening of the week. It's busy on any night of the week which says something about the place.Staff is friendly, cool vibe and I really enjoyed sitting in their hidden  terrace towards the end of the restaurant.Definitely pass by if you're looking for a place to grab a drink near Atwater market.

We came here in a group of 12 during the World Cup 2018 viewing party that they were hosting for the Portugal vs. Iran game and it was a pretty fun time! It was extremely crowded so we were lucky to get 1 table and then share half of another one with other people. There are 3 levels and TVs everywhere so you'll never miss a play. The restrooms are on the 2nd floor but they were pretty small and not very clean. The women's restroom door was open which was a bit off putting since men walk passed to get to men's restroom. The bar area was big but it took a bit to get the bartender's attention because of the crowd. My friend ordered the yogurt parfait and she wasn't too pleased with her. I told her why would she come to a pub and order that but to each her own. I got the fish and chips and shared with some people and it got devoured because we were hungry and it was good. You could never go wrong with fish and chips at a pub. Overall, it was a fun experience and I'm not being a super harsh critic since it was packed for the game which meant slower service yet more demands. I'm not sure if I would have come here if not for the viewing party.

Cheers to this English pub in Montreal! Now some might say no such thing exist unless you're in England, to this I say...have you visited Burgundy Lion? You can walk there from metro station Lionel Groulx, affordable and nice/relaxed environment. Definitely a bar to come to and watch a soccer but also a place to break bread with friends. There are multiple stories, we were on the main floor but we looked up and saw a second floor which we assume can be reserved for bigger parties. Food is good and the staff was kind, it did take a while for us to get our food but as we could tell, it gets busy fast so expect that but I will say the staff does acknowledge you in your wait:) They also have this adorable patio in the back, so for summer days that might be the best idea to try. I'd say make a reservation, specifically during the weekend and weeknights, it gets busy and crowded fast as it's located in a high traffic neighborhood. Enjoy!
Luis,  Alexandra, Joey, Luigi and the Manager Rob was the best!!! Best night in Montreal ever! Seriously recommend this place!

Only came here to get some drinks at the bar. I ended up not choosing the cocktails on the menu and instead went with a spiced rum and ginger ale. Even though it's a simple drink, it was still mixed perfectly. The bartender was efficient and gave a good service. There's was a DJ playing, so it's not that great for convos though. Overall I'd probably stop by here again another time.

Ordered the lamb shepherd's pie with a side of yorkshire pudding. I'm not a huge lamb fan, but the ragu in the pie was really well done. There was a lot on the plate and it even came with a little vinaigrette salad. The yorkshire pudding was a bit burnt on the outside, but it tasted great and had a small side of gravy that was out of the park good.They have an okay beer selection, I had a cider and a red that were alright. Cocktail selection seemed interesting for next time. They also have large whiskey selection.The service was super quick despite it being packed on a Friday night. Music was too loud though, it needed to be a few notches down.

Definitely wasn't our first time there, and will sure be the last. I brought my friend from Toronto to try the place. We were 3 persons. The restaurant was almost empty. They seated us on a table for 2 behind the staircase. I asked kindly to sit on a bigger table. The impolite "manager", named Gabrielle,  said all the tables are of 4 seats. I looked around and saw 2 tables of 4 seats, 1 seated with 2 persons and 1 with 3 (like us). She said they came earlier in a very impolite manner. She also said that she was the manager and she decides where people sit. What a way to treat paying customers!!! We left and will never set foot there again.

They get it. Totally.The staff (Joey was the bartender that night) and patrons were inviting and engaging despite me having to endure a conversation that shook my hackles some time earlier.The bar was a classic Irish bar, with a cozy arrangement of whiskies. The patrons they seem to attract tend to be...which helps for foreigners.I think I found my Montreal bar. It took awhile but I'm very satisfied.

After a light dinner elsewhere, I opted to dig into the cheeseburger here at Burgundy Lion. Great service at the bar, and while there's a full selection of spirits, the choices in beers are limited to macros only. It was a great pour of Murphy's, but I really can get Murphy's just about anywhere.It's a little loud and the place does get rather busy and that's all great. Neat pub vibe and with TV's tuned to sports, a constant amount of cheering going on.Inside and street seating too.

This is a place held dear in our heartsA traditional pub but what sets it apartAre the masterpiece pubfoods, culinary artAnd warm friendly service right from the start3 floors of fun with different spaces A whisky lounge with comfy placesThe solarium among the latest Will put a smile on many facesIt gets pretty busy but it's worth it i promiseTheir Pimms cup is one of the best to be honest Scotches and whiskeys: the list will astonishWith all sorts of beers and cocktails with tonicGawd bless them for tryin to be eco-friendly But the new cardboard straws aren't very bendy And although it is quite trendyThey soggify and that's the end-y (lol)This is a good choice for brunch or for dinnerAnd there's plenty of space whether summer or winter As for the food most items are winnerSuch an excellent spot for a jolly good binger------------------- Installment 13 poetry reviewsA regular hang out for brunch or a drink after work for me n my friends, kind of a central point for us. Always served with a smile, most of the time very quick! We love this lil place quite a bit. Prices are sometimes a bit exaggerated and sometimes gets so busy there's a lil line up which are the only reasons I knocked a star off. Will keep on comin back!

The pros are that the service is good and they DO offer to replace your meal if you don't like it. The con is that the food ranges from 'this is okay' to 'this is not good'.The first time I came, I had the burger, which was meh. The last time, I ordered the Cornish Pasty, which comes with coleslaw. Google Image 'Cornish Pasty' and you're only going to see pictures of golden-brown, flaky dough...because that's what happens to pastry dough when you bake it. What I got was a pasty made with white, gummy, seemingly uncooked dough, sitting in a puddle of sauce that had pineapple coleslaw floating in it. So, those elements don't go together, which is odd, and it doesn't fit the whole British theme, which is also odd, but to have pastry dough that never felt the heat of an oven goes beyond odd into just gross.  I asked the server if the dough was meant to be this way, and she called the manager over, who told me that that's how they make it and he eats it all the time. Yikes. Hope he gets to try cooked pastry someday!

If you just want to have a drink in a beautiful building - this is your place.I can not recommend the food.  Nor the management.My experience happened last night when they were less than 30% full.I ordered the most expensive dinner - the beef roast - expecting a warm plate of food - including "seasonal vegetables".  Nope.My husband ordered Fish and Chips that came with soggy and cold fries and refrigerated mushy peas.  (Later the Manager told me that's how they are served there).I believe my food had been microwaved as it went from scolding hot to freezing.The Pimms was served with 4 quarters of lime - no fruit - just citrus - and sooo sour.But here's the thing - issues happen in restaurants.  I get it.  It's how they dealt with it that is prompting such a bad review.After I told the waitress that my food was cold - she just shrugged her shoulders.  My "seasonal mixed vegetables" (plural) that was supposed to be served with my food was just some unidentifiable diced thing that she said were potatoes.  Well I already had mashed potatoes.  Then she came back and said it was squash.  It was gross.  And my meat was cold and 70% thick inedible fat.We paid our $85 and were leaving when as I got up I was stuck - it was CHEWING GUM.At last the manager came over (we only saw him the rest of the evening berating the bartender for putting too much ice in a drink and telling her not to use her phone etc).  I showed him the gum - he said - "Well nobody else has sat there all day."  WHAT?And then I told him about the horrible meal.He said, "you want a free dessert?"OMG.  Yucky place.  Just don't do it.

I really liked the decor of this place- very low key relaxed feel. The crowd seemed a bit younger for a Friday night but that didn't deter my from enjoying my night.I went for drinks and had a whiskey flight, my first in Montreal - so I was delighted, with over 500 whiskeys to select from - their September special included a 3 whiskey sampler for 18$!Amazing deal- definitely will come back to sample

Quality and prices do not compare...Trying to tell someone who grew up in England how British food is served......seriously?!??Pleasant service, but try serving better roast beef and Yorkshire puddings which are fluffy not hard as a rock, try real gravy instead of brown sauce with flour....Some of us have eaten at a lot of the best tables in the world, this is mediocre....

A year ago I'd give 5 starts. I used to love the breakfast Bunch from hear. But I've had some disappointing experiences lately, some of the staff have left and maybe they kept the standard high. I used to have the Full English but the great spiced potatoes I remember have been hit and miss. Once I was served chips or fries Instead of fried potatoes or sometimes I was served soft black potatoes the tasted earthy. They also serve smoked bacon chunks that are really great but again recently I've had large chunks of fat. 70% fat is not that nice even if is from a smoke house. Lately even the baked beans have suffered - whatever I had last tome was disgusting - super saver beans or something.Black pudding is best Cooked well which it used to be but when it's not cooked enough to dry out a little it's just Slimmy and that too was the case more than once. When this brunch is good it's GREAT when it isn't it's very disappointing, I won't be back for a while. I just hope it regains it's reputation.
Went last summer got a salad with apples and blue cheese was pretty good.We sat outside as it was a very hot summer day :) Staff is friendly

Never been disappointed with Burgundy Lion; I had lunches; I had dinners and I had drinks. This time we went for brunch for Mother's Day. Overall, everything was ok, but the service by our waitress killed the vibe. She is always rushing, and she doesn't take the complete order. She asks for our drinks orders; we order 3 mimosas and she jumps in she says and water for everyone else. No!!! Other 3 persons want to order different drinks. She was horrible listener. We even heard other customers getting upset at her; and told her "LISTEN". The waitress told the client very rudely "I am listening ". Anyway, she did the same thing during our main dish order. I am not sure if due the poor service, that we did not enjoy our food as much as we always do, or the food have been just average. Everything tasted so bland. Some of toasts, and naans were partially burned. The only thing we enjoyed was the drinks. My mom said, she will never come back here. :(

Great vibe, music, and most importantly-food.Came here for brunch. We sat inside but there's a nice patio if you walk halfway in that looks great. We had a party of 8 so we took what we could get.I started with a Bloody Caesar (which is a spicy Bloody Mary with Clamato instead of tomato juice, if you're not familiar) and for my meal got a scotch egg side and the full English breakfast with poached eggs and crumpets.The bloody was spicy and delicious and the breakfast was huge. The scotch egg came with some kind of horseradish condiment that was surprisingly good. The English breakfast came with thick slab bacon, sausage, blood sausage, beans, grilled tomato, two eggs, two crumpets, the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had, with a delicious ketchup (which was unexpected since I usually hate ketchup- there was something really tasty in this one though). Left happy and full and would definitely come back.

Food is decent, but be prepared to be treated poorly by your server. Long waits even once you're seated, and mine literally served other patrons around me who had arrived after I did. Add insult to unjust was rude. Again, decent food but left and went down the block for far superior eats and service.
Breakfasts are very good and its the best place in Montreal to watch a soccer game ! The drinks they have are reasonably priced the staff is nice as well

This is a great casual place to get some drinks and some food (they also serve English breakfast on the weekends)! very low key easygoing vibe with seating indoors (multiple floors) and outdoors both out on the sidewalk terrace and a back terrasse with open roof. (It does get a little loud inside so if you're looking for a more quiet spot then opt for the outdoor tables).Nice selection of beer, cocktails and food as well.  Their food is pretty solid especially for typical English pub fare. Their fish and chips is always a great choice and their roast beef poutine is my personal go-to (large portion and a nice take on the classic poutine with a slight spin on the gravy and roast beef and blue cheese added but don't worry it also has cheese curds for us poutine purists !) helpful tip Though, get the blue cheese on the side... it adds great flavour but it's bold so sometimes when they add it themselves they put too much of it on. Their breakfast is hearty as well and is based on English style breakfast, although most breakfast items on the plates are sometimes a little too oily. Either way for any meal you won't leave this place hungry but I tend to prefer their lunch and dinner items to their breakfast items. This is one of my favourite pubs in montreal so I definitely recommend trying to for yourselves !

The Burgundy Lion is a well-known Montreal institution that I've never had the pleasure of going to. I opted for the fish'n'chips and ordered some pale ale. Both hit the spot real good... I was famished. The service was quick and efficient, considering we were a large group. I appreciated that! The noise level is pretty acceptable considering the number of people inside. I'd come again.

What to do when you are hungry and your are walking on a street full of restaurants?! Yelp it!!!!! Finally found this English pub with a good review and decided to stop by and try.  Pretty noisy for me (yeah, I know... I'm old), but they have a nice patio inside.Such a nice ambience. They even have a booth for groups! Cocktails are around 12$ each and my choice was a mojito style Pimms (an English liquor). MUST TRY. It comes with cucumber and mint. Delicious. To start, Bully Beef Toast ($13)Corned beef on pain brioche, aged cheddar, sweet pepper mix. Oh boy!!! Awesome! The sweet pepper mix comes with sweet onion... The beef is just amazing. My main course was an Angus Burger (16$) AAA Angus burger, cheddar cheese and house chips. What can go wrong with an AAA Angus?! The fries were delicious. I've just missed the mayo maison. My partner's main course was the Cambridgeshire Salad (17$) Grilled chicken salad, Stilton, pears, walnuts. I can say it was hard for him to choose the salad, due to the all succulent options on the menu. But he is a super healthy man! ;)Overall... I'll be back, for sure!

Huge selection of whisky and scotch. Cozy and friendly environment. Welcoming and accommodating staff. Great food: had the burger twice and loved it each time. The lamb shank is very good as well. Interesting collection of photos all around. Overall awesome place to have a few drinks with friends.

Montreal is rather lacking in good pubs, so the Burgundy Lion is a much appreciated spot to go for a casual dinner or pint with friends.  Decor is fun, with lots of British cultural references on the walls.  Food is usually reliably decent and they have a good selection of beers on tap and wine by the glass.  There's also an impressive list of whiskey if that's your thing.  Service is usually good but can get a little slow when they are busy.

One of those places that's just bang on, from sun up to sun down. Whether you're waking up with a Saturday morning pint, kicking back with a Sunday afternoon pint, or unwinding with a weeknight pint, there's really nowhere better than Burgundy Lion. Fancy yourself a bite? Whether you're waking up with a Saturday brunch, kicking back with a Sunday lunch or unwinding with a weeknight dinner, you guessed it... there's really nowhere better than Burgundy Lion.

$131 for 2 drinks  & 2 Beers and 3 entrees.   Waited 20 minutes to be seated 20 minutes for a Menu.  Once food arrived:  Mac and Cheese lacking salt, Angus burger a hockey puck.  Poor staff, poor Pub food.  From reviews thought the food would have been better.   Burgundy lion is a den of liars.

Understated elegance! Come as you are and be treated like royalty! The building is a historical hotel with lots is cool new retro classical white linen and iron. Service was personal and not looking over my shoulder like other place. Drinks were amazing. Clean crystal bar and wine list was nice! Patio available and space for large groups. Old town charm! Lobsters on site in tank. Family of 5 ate til full. Great food diversity on menu! Lovely place! Don't miss

Came here for some brunch. Had the grilled cheese and it was super yummy. A great cosy place with friends especially with the cold outside. My friends had the Yank and it was quite good! This place is also a decent bar at night!

A grungy, very popular English pub that transitions into somewhat of a club (minus dancing) as the night goes on. Staff are very efficient and fun and will keep you "hydrated" all night long. The food menu is actually pretty decent, not your usual pub food. And yes, they do have a number of vegetarian options here, from a portobello mushroom burger to Indian curry. Beware though - if you come with a large group after 10:30, as with any lounge/bar/club, you will be turned away.

The Burgundy Lion is a bit of a classic; a healthy blend of class and comfort, stability and fun. Although it is well known among Montrealers, I still thought it deserved to add another positive review to their collection, a review that I am now writing. The pub located on Notre-Dame Street opens late and serves food until 11 PM (definitely a plus for night owl like my husband and I). They've got a good selection of appetizers and good main courses too. Being vegetarians, we usually go for the samosas or seasonal vegetables as an entree, and their veggie burger as a main dish. The veggie patty is soft and seems to be made of lentils and beans as far as I can tell. Taste-wise it's pretty good, though if I had a suggestion to make it would be to add chili or some other spice to enhance the flavor which currently is a bit tame. Their deserts are also pretty decent; the blueberry and the rhubarb pies are both nice. They've got a huge selection of whiskeys; over 500 according to their menu. Adventurous drinkers will most likely enjoy this feature. They also carry beer on tap, cider, wines and cocktails. They make a mean Irish coffee too (and by that I mean good and strong.)While The Burgundy Lion fills up very quickly on weekends, weekdays are usually a good time to go if you're looking for some intimacy and a manageable noise level. Every time my husband and I have been, we've had a flawless service whether the room was packed or not. I recommend The Burgundy Lion without hesitation; they deserve their good reputation.

Great atmosphere, happy staff and pretty good food. I can't ask for much more.I came here to have dinner with my cousin, whom I haven't seen in months. Caught up over some good food.I started with the cod fish cakes, crispy on the outside, soft in the inside. It was good, however a tad bit salty for my liking.For the main, I went with the burger. It's good but I've had better, I'd go for the fish and chips next time, they looked good!As for dessert...you gotta try the sticky toffee pudding that was recommended by my waitress. She was on the money, if you have a sweet tooth, try it!I'll definitely come by again, it's just a matter of time.

been coming to burgundy lion for a few years l. its my british grandmothers favorite pub. tonight my grandmother took a fall while we were being seated . the staff was very appologetic and really went out of their way to make our experience better. offered us a free bottle of champagne. food was awesome as always. great management and staff and we appreciated their sinceres appologies.

finishing out my stay in Montreal with healthy eating...just kidding, it was with some hearty British fare of Scotch egg, fish and chips, and of course beer!wonderful British pub here. friendly service, no rushing, fair prices. epic whiskey menu, which I would certainly investigate the next time I'm in town.

Place has awesome reviews and I had just visited Atwater Market, so I decided to go here for breakfast. Waitress was awesome and very pleasant. Food wasn't as great. Food was a bit too greasy for my liking. Wish I had come here for lunch and not breakfast. Pros:Great service!Cons:Food is a bit greasy.

The food is hit and miss, the ambiance is great with friendly atmosphere and staff.The inner outside terrace is ordinary however, and if you are not an old fashioned ham lover, stay away from it at brunch.I recommend for evenings in groups where you want to have fun and enjoy the moment, with OK food.

I popped in here  for my last night in Canada and it was brilliant!!*It seemed like a normal British pub to me...just with different beers and more waitresses (so you don't have to order everything at the bar). We ordered looooads of the starters to share (they were all yummy) and then I had the Cambridge salad for my main (as one of my friends recommended it - she was right, it was lovely!) If this was in the UK, we'd call it a gastro pub as the food was really good. I'm afraid I can't be more descriptive as my friends are all better drinkers than me so I can't remember all the details of the evening. I DO remember having an awesome time and being really happy...so this must be a good place to visit!  *The less brilliant part was my hangover which I got to bring with me on the journey home to the UK. Oops.

Had a great salad and bites from a friends indian food something and it was ALL yummy. We sat in their little inside  outside patio for a sunday lunch and had many beers. The service was very attentive and quick.It was a really pleasant experience and if I was in the neighborhood, I would definitely go back.
One of the best pub experiences I've ever had in Montreal.  Incredible service and great prices.  Highly recommended!

Quick snack n vino right after landing in #montreal -  the porkbelly mash was amazing - and heavy -  but so good. Pair it off w/the Montepuciano Di Abruzzo table red -- awesome.  Try to score a patio seat! Super cool street for foodies- #Joebeef is right across the street from joint.  If you can't get in there - venture off to #pubburgundylion - you won't be disappointed.

We had been here once before for drinks and it was great. The menu was intriguing so we planned to come again for dinner. We made reservations and gave the food a shot. As a bar, this place is wonderful for drinks, conversation, and for watching pretty people. The food was not bad - slightly above average pub food. Interesting menu (we started with the cold avocado and cucumber soup and the pork cheek) but our mains were less impressive. My burger was fine but my husband's roast beef was disappointingly skimpy on the beef. A lot of mashed potatoes though. Sunday roast is a sacred English tradition, people! Next time I want to see thick slabs of bleeding meat.

Fun place to be! Take a pint, grab a snack, have an incredible dinner, watch the Canadiens, date night, or all of it! Pros: cute girls in suspenders, over 200 whiskey choices, knowledgeable staff, great food, fun environment, wifiCons: dinner for two is around $80, no parking, loud during game nights

So I've resisted any actual major to-dos at the Burgundy Lion for some time- this can be attributed to the abundant presence of smiley, child-wheeling blond and attractive 30-something Little Burgundy gentrifyers who seem to loiter outside the restaurant during prime brunch hours while they make their over-elaborate goodbyes to one another.All hating aside, these breeder brunchers and me have one major thing that makes us different: they're never hungover and child-free like I'm hungover and child-free during brunch.I was really asked to up my game when my friend insisted on reserving a table last weekend. And it was lovely- there was a soft snow storm blowing outside keeping the place relatively quiet and the service was good. I had the English Toast with boudin. The crumpets, while great, could not compare with the boudin which was to die for. I don't know why I would eat anything else for breakfast.The humble three stars can be attributed to the moment I looked up from the R-rated conversation about a wild weekend I was having with my friend to see a child no more than two starring at our animated table. I have pretty defined feelings about places that welcome young families and vulgar 20-somethings with breakfast cocktails, and then place them side-by-side.Booze and kids in the same place: it just ain't right, son.

I was staying nearby for a work thing, and I popped in to get some takeout. It was pretty full, but there was room to sit at the bar. I ordered the portobello mushroom burger, which was the only vegetarian thing on the menu that seemed 'comfort foodish, to me' which is what I was craving. It took about 15 minutes so I ordered a martini at the bar - it was VERY good and the staff were fun to chat with. I ate the burger in my AirBNB and it was HEAVEN! Just the best burger ever. The fries came with some sort of (miso?) gravy that I still dream about. I'm not even a big gravy fan! EAT THIS BURGER, CHANGE YOUR LIFE.

Like the bar, don't like the food. It's mainly a bar so not a problem. Good selection of whiskeys - for Montreal. Have met nice folks there too. Often, the upstairs is quite quiet - which also works for low key meetings over drinks.

What do you get when you go to an English pub in the middle of French Canada? Eh.... this place, I guess. I came here with a group and most everyone was at least semi satisfied with their food and drinks. They had a good Pimm's cup and their British poutine was pretty delicious. The shepherd's pie was mediocre. The desserts were on the dry side. Prices were a bit high... wouldn't be my first choice, but I wouldn't avoid it either.

Went to joe beef first and no place to sit, then we saw this burger place across the street. It's a English pub but offers great selection of food. We ordered the shepherd's pie and banger & mash. The pie was good, but the mashed potatoes was too dry. Then we had some ice cream for dessert and it's just like the ice cream you buy from a grocery store, nothing special.  Waiters were nice, but takes too long for them to take the orders.
This place is really good if you are English football club fan.All those fans from different club come there to watch matches.

Great place for brunch as an alternative to the standard omelettes and pancakes. Very authentic style English breakfast, food is tasty and location is fantastic right in the heart of Notre Dame. Definitely a must try.

There was a time Burgundy Lion was the only pub in a neighborhood that was just becoming hip. At this time we could get a table there without reservation on a Friday night. Nowadays it is hardly recommended to book a table if you want to visit in the evening even during the week. Today there are many more options to get a drink at Notre Dame street, but Burgundy Lion remains extremely popular regardless of  the competition.  There is a good reason for the love of the crowds, delicious food in the best tradition of the English pubs that has remained consistent as quality over the years, fulfilling brunches, and ah, oh these crazy cocktails I'm always tempted to try, but the beer choice is so good that it challenges your ability to finally pick a drink. Just a look at the whiskey bottles aligned at the bar brings warmth to your heart, wait to read the long menu, the choice of drink may become impossible. Burgundy Lion is a Pub, what a LOVELY pub, bloody fantastic!!!!

An amazing service as soon as we got here. We wanted a place on the terrace and the maitre d made it happen for us in no time! What a great guy.... The food is just so very good, please come, worth every penny.

TLDR: Fun pub with great beer and food.Whenever I need a place to go in the south-west, I go to Burgundy Lion. It's a pub that you know you're going to have a good time. The beer selection is great, their cocktails are delicious, and the food is hearty and tasty.I've gone there for both intimate and large gatherings and it's great for both. However, I do not recommend this pub for dates, because if you go on a busy evening there is no way you will be able to hear each other. The servers are normally very friendly and attentive, with very few off days. However, you have to be empathetic when the crowd gets boisterous and loud.Their brunch is also worth a visit, but remember that you will be having a proper English breakfast. If you think the veggie omelette will be a healthy choice, it's not as it oozes out cheese and is coated in butter. For the healthy version ask for it without dairy products, but don't be upset if it isn't as delicious!Overall a fun and tasty pub to frequent.

Came here to watch the finals of the Wimbledon, just last Sunday. We called a few hours before and we were able to get some prime seats on the patio out back, which was beautiful and cozy! I loved that they had a screen on the patio, as usually most people watch sports inside, and we re able to enjoy the weather on a gorgeous Sunday morning! +1 Amazing back patio to watch sports on.+1 Great phone service to make a reservation last minute.+1 Had a breakfast menu and lunch menu to satisfy a craving+1 The burger I had was great, perfectly cooked+1 French toast was on point, and the bacon was delicious+1 Alcohol selection was good, but QUITE EXPENSIVE!-1 The breakfast menu.... minus the french toast, everything looked the same, absolutely no variation. I was looking for something a little more varied and unique, the menu can definitely be worked on. Every dish need not have been eggs, with bacon with potatoes, most of the dishes was a variation of those three things.-1 My cousin got a drink, and it was god-awful, we have never asked to return a drink, but we politely asked the server and she blatantly said no. There goes an $9 drink. Although this was sucky, the rest of the service was ok so I won't make a ruckus about it. Putting on my nice face.-1 Brunch is my favorite meal, and they kind of ruined it for me with their lack of variation. Ended up cheating on brunch with a lunch menu, saddest day of my life.-1 Service - WAS SO SLOW.... we weren't too bothered because we were watching the tennis match, but any other day and it would have been painful to sit through. At the end, we actually got up and paid the bill at the bar because it was just taking too long. I would skip this place during peak hours, because the service is a bit painful to get through. Overall didn't hate the place, so I would rate it 3.2 stars, but because we were able to really enjoy the patio and the match I'll give it an extra 0.8th of a star. There you go 4 stars as you will. Over and out.
I went here for a 5 a 7 and enjoyed the food and drinks. I kind of wished I sat upstairs where the solarium is, maybe next time!
I went to burgundy Yesterday, always a nice atmosphere. I love their terrasse ! Excellent service again !

I went here with a group of girls to watch the royal wedding, while in Montreal for a bachelorette party. Everything was set up perfectly - tea and coffee in adorable cups, traditional English breakfast, high tea...it was all lovely! We had a great time watching the wedding, and enjoying some English treats (and champagne)!

Fantastic pub!Very well taken care of and managed.  Very professional service.I have been going there for many years and love it; amazing scotch selection!Breakfast on the terrasse in front is wonderful and the blood pudding is nothing like what I remember it being as a kid, having to eat it at home, here it is delicious.Great place, good memories, but taking a star off for no more Guinness; this place should have it again...

Love Burgundy Lion. Very limited gluten free options, but Colonial chicken is amazing, as long as you mention gluten allergy and no bread. I go to Burgundly Lion way too often, its always fun, easy, great vibe and there are tons of things to do in the neighborhood (aka little fun shops to walk into)

Super noisy, totally fabulous pub with good drinks and tasty food. If you're not into having a deep conversation then I would definitely recommend this joint for a drink and a bite. I had a couple of Caesars the last time I was there, as well as the Burgundy Lion sandwich and I couldn't have been happier. Sometimes it's the simple pleasures in life that are most important, and this would satisfy on that count.

Solid English Pub with decent food.The Burgundy Lion isn't particularly remarkable, but it serves its purpose as a neighbourhood pub with a good menu. A fine spot for an afternoon pint, after work bite, or late night drink.

I came in for lunch and I am veryimpressed. I went for the Ploughman's Lunch $14 and Boddington's Pub Ale. Fantastic flavors, simply done. The vegetables did Canada proud, with a slight marinade, all had a distinct character. Pecans, boiled egg , relish (house) and grilled toast sided along with the pork loin slices.July 26 I returned to the Lion on a very warm afternoon for a bite. I went for their version of a roast  beef sandwich with tasty bread, house chips (not French fries), pickle, salad and beer. It was way too hot to sit out in front since the umbrella'd tables were taken. As other reviewers mentioned, some of the  beautiful people hanging outside were as hot as the 104° indexed temp. Open for lunch and a few blocks from the magnificent Atwater Market, a great place to plan for lunch stop when in the area. With Joe Beef and Liverpool House across the street but open evenings only, the area stays hot into the evening, but check this place out for lunch, too..

Great place for drinks! We decided to try the it for lunch. I had the fish and chips. They use cod; I love cod. The fish was fried in a thick batter; can't say it tasted anything. It was served with an interesting mashed green peas, a good tartar sauce and some great fries. My plate came cold...eating cold fish and chips isn't the best but I'm sure once hot it would have been a great lunch. The service was good!

One of my favourite places in Montreal! A must go for any whiskey/scotch admirers, mac n cheese fans, pub cuisine lovers, and pretty much anyone in between.A very knowledgeable staff curates a laid back experience in a welcoming environment. The menu offers variety and options but I personally am bummed the tomato soup has been replaced by gazpacho for the spring/summer. Mind you, they're both awesome.Great spot for after work beers, filling supper or a rowdy night.

Anyone who knows me know that I hate pubs with a passion but this place is AWESOME.We came here as a group of girls for a pseudo bachelorette dinner and we had a great time.We had a nice huge corner booth that was semi private, lots of food (all of it delicious), and great drinks. Service was quite fast for such a busy evening and prices were decent.I think what sets this pub apart is the fact that it's classier than most others..it's not a dingy and dirty pub like most of the ones found in this city.. Oh, and for the record, the shepherds pie was awesome! Mmm I'm drooling just thinking of it...

Tried the house ale, famous bangers and mash and a salad. The ale was very crisp, perfect for the summer time. I usually wouldn't order sausages but I decided to give it a try since it's the dish to try. I was pleasantly surprised by the bangers & mash, sausages were chunky and flavourful, mashed potatoes and gravy were fantastic too. The salad was ok...a little too generous with the blue cheese imo...overall a solid gastropub to come back to.
Good beer, good food, No stress if you want to catch a game, plenty of TV's over there.

Overall I really like this place but my one complaint is that the portions are way too big.  I had the bangers and mash which tasted really good.  I ended up leaving a big chunk of my food behind because I couldn't finish it.  Drinks-wise they have a good selection of beers and cocktails.  I had the cider which was pretty good.It is a pretty popular place and was packed when I went so a reservation would be a good idea just to be sure you get in.
Tried my first ever poutine here. It was cool and nice outside but inside the restaurant was so hot and humid. Service was.... like average NYC, you know. Poutine itself was good, nothing fancy.
If you're looking for a hearty meal to go along side of a nice cold beer, this it the place for you! Warm, peacefully atmosphere, and helpful serves. Food is delicious!

Located south of downtown Montreal in Saint-Henri, this two-floor English pub is a wonderful little establishment which serves microbrews and some pretty tasty food. Let me just start by saying that to Quebec can brew some pretty tasty beer. I would know, I down three pints of this wonderful Blanche De Chambly, a wheat beer brewed locally. It was wonderful, I was in heaven. Add to that a very tasty bleu cheese poutine which I had along with an order of vegetarian samosa and I pretty downed about 10,000 calories in one sitting. Ok, maybe not that many but just don't tell my personal trainer at the gym. The poutine was wonderful and the blue cheese added a  whole new array of flavors to this guilty, unhealthy but yet too-delicious to avoid dish that is poutine.The prices were good, the service friendly although they weren't been very nice when we asked them if they could turn on the television on our floor so we could watch game six of the NHL playoffs. Eventually they did and EVERYONE was watching. I don't understand why they we not cooperating about it in the first place... A neat establishment, I had a good time.

My sister brought me to The Burgundy Lion a British pub located in Little Burgundy for a lunch and beer.   Its a nice place it felt laid back. The waitresses and bartenders were dressed with red suspenders, I kinda felt bad for them, I guess it's the British theme?I ordered the Cambridgeshire Salad- Grilled chicken salad, Stilton, pears, walnuts. It was good and had a lot going on a good portion too.  I got the Stella Artois on tap.  My sister got the Burgundy Fish & Chips. I thought the batter was crunchy and the fries were good.  She loved it and finished it All.    The terrace is nice here in the spring/summer.  I'de for sure come here again and taste more.

Definitely a cool spot to grab a drink. They boast the largest selection of scotch and whiskies of any establishment in the province. The food quality has been in constant decline for the past 3-4 years, everything dish seems thrown together without much care. Meat is of average quality and sometimes overcooked and too dry.
Excellent brunch joint, especially if you're a football fan as they have viewing parties. Service is lovely, food is delicious, prices are reasonable- check it out.

Just before hitting a concert in the Corona theatre, my friend and I decided to spike our blood alcohol content level just a bit. It didn't take long until we found Burgundy Lion as it is right next to the venue. We were there only for the drinks so our destination was the bar counter upstairs which was rather small but our bartender was marvelous. She kept a charming smile throughout our stay and was very knowledgeable. Our drinks were boozy and carefully crafted. My only disappointment was that my Negroni had this distinct taste that I recognize from dated sweet vermouth. Nonetheless, everything else was a perfect preparation for the concert.
I used to live close by and would frequent Burgundy a lot. Love the food and the atmosphere. The place is almost always busy and it attracts a great crowd. One of the best / coolest pubs in Montreal.
Good place! Good beer selection!Good atmosphere ( but sometimes too crowded)Menu is good too! And i love there simple london tea party ( cucumber tuna sandwich super simple but very good)

This is a definitely more of a bar than a restaurant, although they serve some fantastic food! The second you walk in you will see the bar and to the left of that is a seating area for dine-ins. My girlfriend and I first ordered the English Poutine with Roast Beef and this thing was loaded! It was a pretty big serving and we couldn't believe how full we were after devouring this gravy-filled goodness!My main course was the Lamb Shank special, which came with roasted potatoes. Unfortunately, I was pretty full from the Poutine and when the Lamb Shank came my appetite was shot, but still the lamb was really good. It was huge and very juicy. The roasted potatoes were well made as well, not too hard and seasoned excellently. Overall, I liked the atmosphere and it's definitely a good spot to hang out, grab a beer or just get a meal. The only criticism I would have is that there seemed to be a lack of TVs (just 1 TV) there if anyone wanted to come and watch a game along with grabbing a cold one.
Good food and friendly staff. Really enjoyed our office dinner here. Everything was served quickly.No complaints here. A good time was had by all.

Worst service I've ever had in Montreal. I travel frequently to this great city and eat at a wide variety of restaurants. I have always had good to excellent service. Until I happened upon the Burgendy Lion. We were seated promptly, but sat for 15 minutes without a waiter. The host came to check on us. This initially appeared helpful, but he was in a terrible mood. He clearly wanted to take our order as quickly as possible and was very curt, bordering on rude. The water was warm and was dropped off too quickly to ask for ice. The couple next to us for not fare much better. They had to get up and go to the bar to get another beer because they could not flag a waiter down. I was so annoyed with the service, I was going to give 2 stars, but the bangers and mash were very good. The chicken salad was also tasty. So 3 stars. Maybe they were short staffed and the host was just having a bad night...

Solid bar, great service, terrific Brit ambiance, excellent beers on draft and they are never, ever flat. Come for Monday night quiz night for some laughs and meet some cool/smart locals, but come any night for some of the tastiest pub grub that Montreal has to offer.

Great pub with perfect atmosphere, good drink selections, and generally good food.  Most importantly it was the perfect place to watch a World Cup match - in this case the Women's World Cup championship game.  Poutine was very good, though I have to say the Roast Beef dinner was average at best - I've had MUCH better Sunday Roasts in England and I was hoping this would be better at The Burgundy Lion.  But the beer selection was good, whiskeys were extensive if that's your thing, and it was a great place to watch football.  Plus, it's a cool neighborhood and well worth a visit.

We came here under the pretense that it would be a good experience. I believe if you're looking to get drunk and loud, then this is the place. Unfortunately for us, it was a let down.Drinks are plentiful and there are plenty of screens to watch sports on. So if you are looking to do that, you might want to head down to this pub.However, we were looking for good food and great beers. They didn't deliver on both counts.Right when you step in, it is loud. I mean it is a pub, so I didn't expect anything else. The set up was awkward; we waited by the door, not knowing if we were to sit down on our own or wait for a hostess. A few minutes later a server saw us standing and waved down another waitress to seat us. We were seated but the first sign of trouble started; there were gnats and flies flying all around us. Umm, gross. Then it took a while for the waitress to come down. She didn't give very friendly service. Throughout, the service was slow and sporadic. My boyfriend said his beers were just "OK". Whatever that means. He ordered the fish and chips. You would think something that has two items would be prepared fairly decent, but the chips were chewy and lacking any seasoning. The fish itself was super oily.I ordered the roast with Yorkshire pudding. The Yorkshire pudding and meat were cooked very well. This would have been a one star review if it wasn't for those two items. However, the veggies were all cooked unevenly. It was expensive meal for what we both got.I wouldn't return to this place. However, if you're looking to be loud and drunk, I believe this is your place. To each their own.
Bad food, horrible service. A steady decline over several years. I once gave this place 5 stars!!!! After last night I'll never go back.

My boyfriend and I went for dinner tonight with our puppy Austyn and sat on the patio, which was great! They brought us a cute little plastic bowl for him to have water and were extremely accommodating, The manager who I didn't get his name was very nice and our waitress Taylor was very on top of everything and very friendly. the food was really good. I had fish and chips with mashed peas. (ohmygod!) and my boyfriend had the burgundy ribs with mashed potato. we'd gone a couple months ago for breakfast, it was a very classic British breakfast (not my thing, however my boyfriend loved it!) Overall a great place any time of day!

Really good English brunch! I ordered the full English breakfast, and loved everything in the plate. The thick bacon is a must and their potatoes are so flavourful with garlic on top. Watch out if you don't like garlic cuz I saw ppl complained about it. To me it's better with garlic. Brunch is fairly priced but their drinks are expensive.
Great pub in the area. The place is huge and so the service suffers as a result, but in the terms of pub fare, grub and booze, this place is solid.

I've been there more times that I can count. The main reason is that the people there work so hard and so well. The food is great for pub food, better than many restos.The alcohol can get a little expensive and it's unfortunate you can only buy beer by the glass but I can see a few reasons for that (other than the obvious lucrative aspect for the owner). Waiters are always there to check if you're ok and need anything else and make you feel looked after and appreciated. Quality-price the best place in the entire area.
One of my all time favorite places to go.Easy for lunch or for a quick pint on the way home.

Went here today for brunch with my friends. We started by sitting out on the patio. We were served by numerous staff and didn't have one consistent server. This led to sloppy service. We started off with some mimosas and Caesar's which were delicious. We were told that there would be a 10 minute longer than average wait for the food due to the power outage they experienced earlier that morning. Totally fine. When the food did come out my friend's meals were brought out significantly earlier than mine and I was left waiting for my Arnold eggs Benedict that I had asked for without tomatoes. As I got up to walk into the restaurant to see what was the cause of the delay my meal was being brought out. When it arrived to the table it was cold and had tomatoes. It started to rain and the only server who was working with purpose and focus asked us if we wanted to move inside. We were then brought into a covered terrace. Again with a new change of service providers, our dirty plates were left on our table uncomfortably long. Would not return.
Great vibe,service was awesome. I order the special chicken burger which was not on the Menu
Loved it here.  Would absolutely go back. Had a great burger and my gf had a great vege burger. Cocktails were also good!

Not bad a place but not a great place either. The room is warm, people somewhat friendly but nothing special... Especially the service that a found to be somewhat lacking.Good place for friends and talk but for that I think you can find better... for example, les soeurs grises in old Montréal. More confortable, better service for around the same price.

Excellent bar with excellent food. I recommend the fish and chips. The fish is perfectly cooked and the fries are just right. The poutine with roast beef is the best poutine I have had so far but the real star of the show is the sticky toffee cake . I could have just come to eat that. Very tasty. Great ambiance.

The Burgundy Lion is one of those places, that you'll always be happy to go to.  The best combination of atmosphere, service, and food.I often fist for early breakfasts (and to catch a match of football) and the atmosphere at this time is great.  A young crowd is often there (20-30ish) English and French and we have a great time watching and talking.The service is top-notch - with the waiters and waitresses being genuinely ready to be of help.  Love their attitude. The food, especially breakfast, is definitely something to come back for.  The menu is not extensive, but what is available is served in generous proportions and fresh (try the English porridge)Go and enjoy

Chaotic service.Bad, wobbly table.Good Scotch Eggs.Tasty tomato soup.Horrible Yorkshire stuffed with sausage.And if someone tells you it's their birthday you don't ignore it & not even make the slightest of gestures.The eggs and the soup is what prevented me from giving this place a lower score, kudos to the kitchen at least (Yorkshire Pudding excluded from praise).

Been wanting to come here since I came to Montreal last summer, though I kept hearing it was crowded and a bit pricey, plus being in Griffintown almost, I just never found the opportunity. Last Sunday night, I did. And we had a really good time.It's basically just a really good, nice, modern pub. Huge whisky selection, and everything else. We were a group of 8, so we ordered all kinds of stuff. I had bites of samosa, Shephard's pie, green salad, scotch egg, and it was all just AMAZING. Also the drinks were strong, and the service was good. Also, at first there wasn't a table, but we got a 4 seater, and grew it into an 8 seater within the hour. Also, I thought our check would be expensive, but it turned out pretty average to be honest. There are tons of MTL bars selling $8 pints that are super shitty compared to BL, which is nice.I'll definitely return, and chances of going out of my way are higher.

I traditionally celebrate my birthday at pubs, and wanted to find a new one to do so this year. I had heard nothing but good things about the Burgundy Lion, and being relatively close to home, I thought I'd give it a try. I made reservations for a group of 10 with Toby, and hoped desperately that we were seated near a TV to catch the Habs game. Upon arrival, I was uber pleased to see he had seated us in a "private" nook in the back on the left-hand side on the first floor. It's a large table backed by a booth and finished off with chairs, and has its very own TV. I will admit, I put on a special happy dance once I discovered this. The decor is quirky British pub style (mind you I've never been across the pond, so I can't say it's absolutely authentic). The servers are friendly and knowledgeable on the selection of beer and food, and very attentive. And although the group grew from 10 to maybe about 15-16, our server was always welcoming of a new face, promptly asking them if they wanted a drink or something to eat. We requested to have them put the game sound on instead of the music, which they were happy to do (nice touch). The beer selection is a good mix of European and Canadian; loving ever opportunity to try new beer, I opted for a couple of pints of Boddington (described as a cross between a blonde and a cream ale, very good!). To start Danny and I shared the veggie samosas, which had a surprising kick to them; full of flavour and perfect portion size. I had been so excited for fish 'n' chips since I had made the reservations, and of course ordered them; Danny had the Colonial Chicken. The fish was so delicious; flaky and flavourful, and wasn't too battered, so there was a good fish to batter ratio. The fries were perfectly salted and had that desired crispy on the outside, soft on the inside thing going on. Danny, being a big fan of Asian/Southeast Asian cuisine (heck, he is Mauritian after all), had nothing but great things to say about the Colonial Chicken. I had a bite myself and thought it was delicious too. Overall, everyone in our party seemed to really enjoy the food, drinks and ambiance. A side note, it is a little pricier than normal pub fare, but it definitely warrants it. I am a fan and will most definitely be back!

Location: Notre-Dame O. The nearest subway is Lionel-Groulx and it's about a 10-minute walk from there. The place: Pub-ish, with wood floors and decor, and of course, the standard British bar set-up. They have two floors and two terraces - the one in the middle of the pub is pretty cool and will definitely be worth checking out once they open it up. The layout is OK but the massive staircase in the middle of the place takes up a lot of space and is almost immediately in front of the entrance. The food: I hate to go against the grain but I don't know what all the fuss is about. It's standard breakfast fare and there isn't anything exceptional about it. I ordered The Yank which included eggs, potatoes, a side of meat (your choice - I went with sausage), a side of bread (again, your choice - I got the English muffin) and a fried tomato. As far as the eggs go, I got mine scrambled and they were perfectly cooked - I hate eating runny eggs so am always apprehensive about the state of my eggs - but these guys rocked it. Well, as much as you can rock scrambled eggs. Hot, moist, perfect. The fried tomato was also perfectly cooked and quite good. The sausage were dryer than sandpaper and hard, so I'm guessing they were sitting around for a while before they found their way into my plate. The English muffin was soft and fluffy, though bland, but the biggest disappointment were the potatoes. I mean, I had high hopes for these because they looked and smelled real good! Sadly, looks can be deceiving and these were not only undercooked but lacking in any real flavor. Bummer. I like a good patate with my breakfast. The fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious AND it had no pulp. I am not a fan of pulp. Service: OK. Our table was visited by a variety of people and it was hard to keep track of who our 'official' waiter was. Granted, the place was busy due to the upcoming HABs game that was about to start. We were playing Boston - this is serious business!Cost: Very decent - the meal was $8 and the OJ was $3.50. I was pretty well-fed for that price.

The lion is my living room away from home! I really like this place, it's a nice place to meet friends for a beer after work or to watch the game.I like sitting upstairs, I find it a little less crowded and  the downstairs bar has a tendency to feel like you're standing in a hallway but that being said it's still far and away the best place to have a beer in the neighborhood.The lion is also one of my favorite places to grab a bite  I would say everything on the menu is pretty good, other then the fish and chips and the burger which are awesome, everything else is good and I can assure you that you won't be disappointed. The service has always been good the wait staff always very nice and ready with a suggestion on what's good to eat or what type of beer to drink. The system of waiters, waitresses and busboys ensures that you get good service even when they're packed on Friday and Saturday nights. The decor has modern pub written all over it, with all sorts of faux British decorations all over the walls. The first floor layout is a little odd if you want to stand at the bar since you will be in the space that serves as the hallway that leads to the back of the pub but upstairs is great and if given a choice I enjoy sitting up there. The only caution I would give, is that if you're looking to have a quiet dinner where you can have a conversation with your dinner companion this may not be the greatest place. It tends to get very noisy in the evening, making conversation difficult without yelling. Drop in on a game night for a beer I know you'll be sold too.
Nice place to hang out with friends, young crowd. Great burgers principally the Burgundy Lion, my favorite... but even if they close late, their kitchen does not...
Went there recently, I liked the music, tried the beer brewed on site which was quite good. The staff are courteous.
Delicious shepherds pie - but it was cold when served. Still tasted good - wouldn't consider it an ideal place for dinner but definitely a fun place for a late night hang-out with friends.

If you are looking for a solid pub, Burgundy Lion is this non pretentious place where you know you'll eat fresh and good food plus get good beer. They have this nice little indoor patio in the middle of the restaurant, which could feel quite romantic I find. They also have a patio outside of the restaurant. You get fresh food for a fair price and get served with a smile and a joke from time to time. Decor is very simple but nice. Only thing we weren't crazy about was the dessert, but otherwise, it's a winner.

I make a point of sitting upstairs when I can since I enjoy the company of one of their newer bartenders (Aly with the short hair). The roast beef poutine seemed costly at first glance but was definitely worth the price tag considering it worked to fill two people. House Pale Ale is better than most home brews and the Angus Burger absolute stuffed me. The joint gets bonus points as most free pour locations earn ;). Props to waitress Sophie for always putting up with our shenanigans while flashing that smile. Nice to have a place where the staff know what they're talking about with their booze.

Went here with friends for a celebration, to have drinks and nibbles. They seated us at tiny tables (3) for a group of twenty people. They wouldn't let us move to tables to eat food. The weirdest and rudest thing is that they are so quick about you paying your bill immediately for what you order and then they take an hour to bring it to you. The service was so slow and the servers were very oblivious. Unfortunately, I ordered Lyle's Yorkshire pudding. Don't do what I did. This place does not know how to make pastries. It was burnt, I had to saw into it with my knife and the middle filling was burnt/cooked out. I was thinking about coming here for high tea. Nope, no thanks. I will stick to Le Cardinal.

We were visiting Montreal for a week and tried this last night. Great place for drinks and food.  There were a lot of people..very busy so we were excited to try. Their whiskey list is impressive.  My bf tried a whiskey tasting and I ordered red rum as a cocktail. For dinner I ordered georgie's catch and my bf got the vegetation masher curry with shrimp. Both were delicious and dessert was raspberry trifle. highly recommend any one to try ...even if just drinks
Great bar food.  Huge selection of drinks/cocktails.   Eye candy for the guys.  Or girls...
Delicious breakfast while watching English premier league! Excellent garlicky potatoes and mushrooms, flavourful tomatoes and bread a choice includes crumpets!  Excellent, attentive and kind service!

I haven't been here in a while and it seems like they changed their menu. I chose the English Poutine topped with blue cheese, curd cheese, caramelized onions and a whiskey-based gravy. It was the worst poutine I've ever eaten. The mix of blue cheese with the whiskey-flavored gravy was just too overpowering and the caramelized onions did nothing to help this dish. If you must try this out, I strongly suggest you order the blue cheese on the side. I wish I had. The service was great but the rating is exclusively for tonight's experience. I've eaten here before and I've always had a good meal. It's too bad they had to screw up on such a simple dish.

A good place for drinks or food. Have been here dozens of times for both.  The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is good. Menu was recently updated and still has a lot of good food. My favourite is usually the colonial chicken.  Haven't had a bad meal here. It's a great section of town to eat or drink because there are so many options.  This is definitely a great spot
I adore this pub! Fantastic aesthetic and atmosphere. Love Monday Trivia Nights and their food is amazing, though, a bit on the pricey side.

Came here to watch the habs-bruins game, great atmosphere, great pub food. Their alcohol selection is big and nice.I had fish and chips, great with generous portions. Had the sticky toffee pudding and it was also great. Nice place, gets really crowded during sports events, nice staff.

I did not partake in sampling their GINORMOUS scotch collection, next time better watch out Burgundy!The Poutine week special with the rabbit meat (or was it duck meat) added an interesting twist to a classic. Had a random celebrity sighting (shook hands with Justin Trudeau) and merriment with friends was had.If you are a scotch lover, this is the place to be.

The Place and the ambiance are really atractive, and the menu really affordable. Just one thing: Why all the pretty waitresses are so rough to serve??? It seem like always the tips than we give is not enough! (between 15 and 20% always) And badly: what is the problem to serve in french???  I've been arrived a couple of times with french people and you can tell: the service is not the same! Shame

I had a reservation across the street for dinner and had arrived almost an hour early.  The Burgundy Lion was the perfect place!The bar was completely full when I had arrived.  I waited a couple of minutes, pacing a bit to see if anyone might be leaving soon.  Why would they - this place is great.  After another moment checking out the place, I had noticed some traffic up and down the stairs in the center of the room.  Brilliantly I deducted that as will any respectable pub, if there is a bar on the first floor, there is another bar, albeit a bit smaller, upstairs as well.  Sure enough, there was, and just as fate would have it, one barstool open and waiting for me.  I sat down and ordered a Hendricks Martini, up.  The waitress immediately asked me if I would like that with a cucumber.  Impressive.  Not many know that Hendricks is cucumber and rose flavored as opposed to the more traditional juniper.  I agree to the cucumber and we're off.  The drink is prepared with perfection.  Moments later the bartender comes back over and asks me if the drink was made to my liking.  Again, I am impressed.  How often does this happen?  I tell her, it is really great.  Her reply - "I know....it's because it was made with love".  This place just keeps getting better and better.  My only regret was leaving, just in time to make my reservation across the street.  I will be back.
Came here for brunch and had the English Toast with sausage. One of the softest French toast I ever had and the service was just amazing!

I came to the pub burgundy lion for the first time for brunch.Walking in, the wooden decor and melange of art on the walls made a "cool" atmosphere. The place was spacious and we sat down comfortably inside. The pub also had an outside patio.Before ordering, we decided to move outside to enjoy the sun, but there were certain seats that did not have shade. The waiter was patiently accommodating as we moved back inside.I ordered the cornish chicken on couscous. The meal was plated beautifully and was delicious! Definitely recommend. After tax, my meal came to $20. Well worth for the quality.My party whom had ordered burgers and fries were also complimentary of their meals.All in all, I would definitely recommend this place. Great food, service, and atmosphere!

The Lion is what they consider a gastro pub. The food is great as well as their selection of liquors.  Without a doubt the reason why St. Henri has become a prime destination for many on the western part of the island.  The pub has slowly become a soccer (footy) pub as well.  Arsenal and Chelsea bring in the largest crowds. Upstairs is where u want to be on Saturday and Sunday morning for epl action.

My boyfriend and I went here for a few drinks and a late snack on our trip to Montreal. It was 9:30pm on a Tuesday and a decent size crowd were enjoying themselves when we arrived. The service was quick and friendly. Drinks were delicious. I had 2 cocktails and my boyfriend tried 2 different draft beers and we loved everything we bought! We had such a great time that we went back again the next day for lunch. I continued to explore the menu by ordering 2 other cocktails along with fish and chips. My boyfriend stayed on the same path, trying a few more of their drafts beers and eating the roast beef sandwich. We reluctantly left after enjoying our 2 hour lunch.
Just a great place overall. Food, service and athmosphere. The latter especially during the rugby world cup finals.

We visited as a group of four on a Saturday evening to celebrate a birthday.  It was definitely an enjoyable meal!The food is great.  The menu has all kinds of traditional pub fare, such as fish and chips, bangers and mash, etc, but extremely well done.  We started off with stuffed yorkshire puddings and samosas.  I would definitely return one evening just to have a pint and some more yorkshire puddings, they were that good.  Our mains were equally excellent, and well presented too.  It is a beautiful space, I could tell a lot of time and $$$ went into renovations.  The only downfall was that the waitstaff could have been a little more attentive.  It wasn't all that busy, and yet we sometimes had a hard time getting a hold of our waitress to ask for our bill, and then to actually pay.
Amazing tomato soup (that is vegan). I will dream about it I think for a while until I have it again. The rest of the food I had was quite good, as well, but did I mention the tomato soup? :-P

Great food, good service. Place was packed on Tuesday lunchtime. Outdoor seating in the street can be nerverack since its on the street...ha. Prices seem a bit steep but they have good quality and all the Brit faves.

Amazing!!My evening began with being tasked to find the perfect English pub in Montreal, and my evening ended with great praise! This is truly a blockbuster pub, with great food, excellent Guinness and above all else simply magnificent staff!Thank you Burgundy Lion for a stunning evening.See you for breakfast......

Great place. The food is much better than I expected. The Colonial Chicken is so good that I came back and ordered it again 2 days later. The staff is super friendly & welcoming. Easy on the eyes as well.
The place was pretty crowded on a Saturday night but they squeezed us in. Good food and drinks (had the Ploughman's lunch) and the servers are very attentive. Fun ambiance too.
Food is ok, drinks are gd but couldn't stay longer than 45 min the music was so loud i couldn't even have a conversation with my friends... The Music is annoying

The Lion is my favourite pub here in Montreal. Not only is it a solid English-style pub (which is OBVIOUSLY not as good as Australian pubs, but close enough), it's also the closest to my 'hood, and a great local to have.The food is good here, and my personal favourite is the BL sandwich  - it's packed with ridiculous amount of rare roast beef, and comes with crisps. I've never once felt less than absolutely stuffed after eating one. Wash it down with a pint of the house larger, and you're set for an afternoon of drinking...The scotch selection here is VERY impressive. It's one of the best in town, which while not what I'd expect from a "ye olde pub", is a very nice surprise.While there's not a lot of TV screens, there are enough to catch the sporting event of your choice. The upstairs area has some big tables for groups, and there's a contained outside area for when the nice weather returns - I'm not sure if smokers can smoke in there.

I have heard a lot about this place and really had high hopes. I would have given it more stars but the service was effing horrendous. To the point where I almost got up and walked out. The waitress our table had (a small table of THREE girls) dropped off teh menu and avoided ALL EYE CONTACT for about an hour. She waited all the other tables around us and behind us and even BESIDE us but ours seemed to be an impossibility. After finally giving our order and getting our BOTCHED plates (I had ordered the beef poutine and got a regular one, which they still charged me $18), it took another 20 minutes to get ANOTHER waitress to our table to try and fix the mistake. All this and we haven't been able to place the drink orders because our waitress RAN AWAY after we gave our food order.The food itself was TO DIE FOR (once we got our full plates). The blue cheese and beef poutine is heavenly, the mayo they give you seems to be home-made and they burgers.... mmmmmmmmm.I wish i can give one rating for the service and another for the food. Going into a pub, i'm not looking for fantastic service however I'm not looking to go behind the bar and get my drinks either. I don't know if this woman was in her "monthly" time or what but let me tell you, she was unhappy with life and seemed to have a hatred for our table.This being said, AVOID the tall waitress with super short bleached hair because if she's in a bad mood, you'll leave there in a bad mood too but definitely go to try that poutine!!!! And the cucumber gin & tonic... Mmmmmmmmmm...

An old buddy Annie  has emergency called me and yelled through her phone."Dom you got to come over right now! There are a ton of hot ladies here! Comment followed by screams of women. 4.8 seconds later, I find myself at the Burgundy Lion pub. I sat at the bar filled to capacity with men. Loads and loads of men !I order a beer from a scruffy looking bartender , who ignores me and proceeds to poor a beer .  It turns out the beer was for himself. As I saw him sitting amongst the sea of men in the bar. Aside from old Drink for himself Guy . The Burgundy may wanna work on mixing the ClienteleOther than that, the beer was great  The food is making me hungry now!!

Good food, not great, but service that, in our case was not very good: inaccurate and very slow.
